data.title: 2024 U.S. Open: Which player has the most victories in 124-year history of the tournament?
data.meta_description: Which player has the most career victories in the U.S. Open? Find out that and more ahead of the 124th tournament at Pinehurst this week.
data.text:
The 124th U.S. Open Championship takes place this week, and all eyes are focused on Pinehurst Resort.

With the exception of two world wars, the U.S. Open has been played every year since 1895 and some of the biggest names in the sport have held the sterling silver trophy.

There are quite a few things to watch for in the 2024 tournament, including Phil Mickelson’s attempt to get over the hump and complete his career grand slam. Defending champion Wyndham Clark would be the first repeat winner since Brooks Koepka in 2018 and Tiger Woods could enter more rarified air with his fourth victory.

As things heat up this week, let’s take a look at the history of the major. Who has the most all-time wins? How many times has Pinehurst hosted the tournament? We’ll attempt to answer those questions and more below.

GRAYSON MURRAY: How the USGA is paying tribute to Grayson Murray at US Open in Pinehurst

EAT UP: Meet the longtime NC-based concession stands at the 2024 US Open at Pinehurst No. 2

How many U.S. Opens has Pinehurst hosted?

This will be the fourth U.S. Open played at Pinehurst No. 2. The first came in 1999, the second in 2005 and the third in 2014.

Who have been U.S. Open champions at Pinehurst?

1999: Payne Stewart

2005: Michael Campbell

2014: Martin Kaymer

How many times has Tiger Woods won the U.S. Open?

Woods has three U.S. Open victories, with the most recent coming in 2008 at Torrey Pines. He knocked out Rocco Mediate in a playoff to secure his 14th career major. He also won in 2002 (Bethpage Black) and 2000 (Pebble Beach).

Who has the most all-time U.S. Open victories?

Six players have won the U.S. Open at least three times in their careers. With a win at Pinehurst this week, Brooks Koepka would join that list.

Here are the players with the most all-time wins in the U.S. Open.

Jack Nicklaus 4 (1962, 1967, 1972, 1980)

Ben Hogan 4 (1948, 1950, 1951, 1953)

Bobby Jones 4 (1923, 1926, 1929, 1930)

Willie Anderson 4 (1901, 1903-05)

Tiger Woods 3 (2000, 2002, 2008)

Hale Irwin 3 (1974, 1979, 1990)

Past U.S. Open champions

Here’s a list of the winners of the previous 123 U.S. Open Championships.
